summary: Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport (ATL) is the world's busiest airport by passenger traffic and aircraft movements. Located 10 miles south of downtown Atlanta, it covers 4,700 acres and has five parallel runways. Named after former mayors William B. Hartsfield and Maynard Jackson, it serves over 100 million passengers annually. ATL is Delta Air Lines' primary hub, offering flights to 225 domestic and international destinations. Other airlines like Frontier, Southwest, and Spirit also operate from here. The airport is mostly in Clayton County but extends into Atlanta and nearby cities. MARTA rail lines serve the domestic terminal.
